direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are simple getter methods with similar control flows and return types.
Both methods return specific attribute values, though for different attributes.
Both methods handle object comparisons and may throw exceptions if the input is invalid.
Both methods involve data representation, though encode() deals with binary data.
Both methods modify the internal state of the object, though decodeAttributeBody() does so more extensively.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require attribute initialization before they can be used.
Environment setup is required before accessing attribute names.
Both methods verify attribute names and handle similar exceptions.
